data.approach: Fix overflow: hidden on .epic-group CSS in /tasks3 that clips TaskIdBadge dropdown menu

data.taskTitle: statusactionbadge dropdown not visible behind taskdetailPaneA
summary: Fixed dropdown clipping by removing overflow: hidden from .epic-group CSS class
Added comment warning not to re-add overflow: hidden
reviewFocus: Verify dropdown now appears above other content on /tasks3 page

data.taskTitle: statusactionbadge dropdown not visible behind taskdetailPaneA
summary: Fixed TaskIdBadge dropdown clipping behind TaskDetailDrawer on /tasks3 page
Removed overflow:hidden from .project-content CSS class that was clipping nested dropdowns
Changed dropdown-content from DaisyUI hover pattern to fixed positioning with calculated coordinates
Dropdown now uses position:fixed with JavaScript-calculated top/left based on trigger element bounds
Added viewport boundary clamping to prevent dropdown from going off-screen

data.taskTitle: statusactionbadge dropdown not visible behind taskdetailPaneA
summary: Implemented portal-based dropdown rendering to escape stacking context
Added z-index: 2147483647 (maximum int) to ensure dropdown is always on top
Fixed mouse hover gap with delay timeout pattern
Removed overflow-x: clip from TasksActive that was clipping dropdowns
reviewFocus: Test dropdown visibility on /tasks3 page when TaskDetailPaneA is open

suggestedTasks.title: Resolve UI Layer Stacking for Status Action Dropdown
suggestedTasks.description: Diagnose and fix z-index or positioning conflict preventing statusactionbadge dropdown from being visible behind taskdetailPaneA component. Investigate CSS stacking context and potential layout issues in the /tasks3 route. Ensure dropdown is accessible and properly layered within the UI hierarchy.
suggestedTasks.reason: Dropdown visibility problem discovered during initial investigation
